conclusion: Analyze positions of Cars A and B as functions of time.
Position is found by integrating velocity with respect to time.
Car A has a constant velocity of 40 ms^-1.
Car B starts from rest and accelerates uniformly.
Velocity of Car B at t = 20 seconds is 40 ms^-1.
Acceleration of Car B: a = 2 ms^-2.
Position of Car A at t = 10 seconds: x_A(10) = 400 m.
Position of Car A at t = 20 seconds: x_A(20) = 800 m.
Position of Car A at t = 30 seconds: x_A(30) = 1200 m.
Position of Car B at t = 10 seconds: x_B(10) = 50 m.
Position of Car B at t = 20 seconds: x_B(20) = 200 m.
Position of Car B at t = 30 seconds: x_B(30) = 450 m.
Distance at t = 10 seconds: Δx_10 = 350 m.
Distance at t = 20 seconds: Δx_20 = 600 m.
Distance at t = 30 seconds: Δx_30 = 750 m.
Maximum distance occurs at t = 30 seconds.
Maximum distance between Car A and Car B is 750 m.
